title: Little Boy Suspended After Bringing Spent Bullet Casing Into Classroom
text:
Former Muslim Tells Liberals Their Politically Correct Appeasement Is Helping Terrorists 
“I was handed a piece of paper,” she wrote. “No words, just eyebrows raised in disgust at my son, explaining that his behavior warranted a 7 school day suspension. Which I still was expected to pay tuition for, of course. And a threat that if his enthusiasm for guns continued, he’d be permanently expelled.” 
Enthusiasm for guns? Hardly. Besides bringing a shell casing — not a “shotgun bullet”— to school Tuesday, Hunter also used another toy as a make-believe gun the day before, according to news station KTVI . 
But there was a reason for this temporary “enthusiasm”: Hunter had gone “target practicing with his Police Officer Grandpa” over the weekend, Jackson explained on Facebook. That was where he picked up the shell casing so he could later sneak it to school and show his buddies.   
Read Jackson’s full post below: 
Bringing the shell casing to school was definitely a big no-no, but still, suspending Hunter — while condescendingly raising their eyebrows in disgust, as Jackson wrote — was both outrageous and stupid, as this incident could have easily been used as a teaching moment. 
“This could have been handled by explaining appropriate behavior at school,” Hunter’s mom wrote. “He’s 4. This doesn’t hurt him, or teach him, or help him. Just his parents, who do not condone bringing these kinds of things to school. Ever. Had we known, we of course would have stopped it. But every time he or another child mentions a gun (like every boy I grew up with did) they punish him.”
